metadata.title: Observations of Short-tailed Albatross (Diomedea albatrus) in the Bering Sea

creators.name: Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS)

metadata.description:
Short-tailed Albatross (Diomedea albatrus), once a widespread North Pacific
species, currently has a population of approximately 400 birds. This note
reports an unusual pelagic sighting of 14 Short-tailed Albatrosses on 7
September 1990 in the Bering Sea. Three additional sightings of individual
birds from June to September 1990 are also reported.
metadata.notes:
Purpose: To report on the observations of short-tailed albatross (Diomedea albatrus) in the Bering Sea
